 <title>Hayden Panettiere Is Reentering Treatment For Postnatal Depression</title>
 <link>http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/Hayden-Panettiere-Treatment-Postnatal-Depression-2016-41300151</link>
 <description><a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/Hayden-Panettiere-Treatment-Postnatal-Depression-2016-41300151"><img width="160" height="160" src="http://media2.popsugar-assets.com/files/2016/05/12/978/n/1922398/f468ac22_edit_img_image_845315_1463091195.large.jpg" /></a><p></p>
<p><br>
<p><a class="sugar-inline-link" title="Latest photos and news for Hayden Panettiere" href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/Hayden-Panettiere" target="_blank">Hayden Panettiere</a> is checking into a rehab facility for ongoing treatment of her postnatal depression. The actress <a href="https://twitter.com/haydenpanettier/status/730854394770673665"  target="_blank">took to Twitter on Thursday to announce the news</a>, saying, "The postpartum depression I have been experiencing has impacted every aspect of my life. Rather than stay stuck due to unhealthy coping mechanisms I have chosen to take time to reflect holistically on my health and life. Wish me luck!" The same day Hayden made her announcement, it was also revealed that her <a href="http://www.popsugar.com/entertainment/ABC-Cancels-Nashville-41295954" >ABC show Nashville had been cancelled</a> after four seasons.</p>
<p>Hayden first opened up <a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/Hayden-Panettiere-Battling-Postpartum-Depression-38764286" target="_blank">about her struggles with postnatal depression</a> in October, nearly a year after giving birth to her daughter, Kaya. At the time, her rep confirmed to <strong>People</strong> that she would be receiving treatment, and Hayden had been vocal about her battle, saying in an interview, "Women need to know that they're not alone, and that it does heal." In January, she <a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/Hayden-Panettiere-Critics-Choice-Awards-2016-39840561" target="_blank">made her return to the red carpet at the Critics' Choice Awards</a> and also <a href="http://www.popsugar.com/celebrity/Hayden-Panettiere-Wladimir-Klitschko-After-Treatment-39237187" >supported her fiancé, Wladimir Klitschko</a>, at his boxing match in Germany. </p>
<p>As recently as March, Hayden seemed to be gaining control of her depression and hoping to inspire other women to be equally brave. During <a href="http://www.popsugar.com/celebrity/Hayden-Panettiere-Talks-About-Postpartum-Depression-2016-40678373" >an interview with People</a>, the 26-year-old revealed that she had "been trying to be much more open and honest about who I am," adding, "I'm an adult, and [I don't] have to falsify who I am." </p>
</description>

<item>
 <title>Why Queen Elizabeth II Once Cried Over a Ship</title>
 <link>http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/Visiting-Royal-Yacht-Britannia-Edinburgh-41190027</link>
 <description><a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/Visiting-Royal-Yacht-Britannia-Edinburgh-41190027"><img width="160" height="160" src="http://media2.popsugar-assets.com/files/2016/05/03/824/n/1922398/9463093b_edit_img_image_41176789_1462288438_a.large.jpg" /></a><p></p>
<p><small class="source">Image Source: <a href="http://www.gettyimages.com"     target="_blank">Getty / Tim Graham</a></small></p>
<p>It was said that when Queen Elizabeth II's royal yacht, the <a href="http://www.shopstyle.co.uk/browse/britannia?pid=uid0-23489800-17" class="ss_inline_link auto_link_filter no_shopsense_url_rewrite" title="Shop for Britannia" target="_blank">Britannia</a>, was decommissioned in 1997, she cried. It was a remarkable and rare show of emotion from the legendarily stoic queen, giving the public a brief glimpse into her private family life with husband Prince Philip. The public tear was also a testament to her love for what became known as the royals' country home at sea.</p>
<p>When Elizabeth and Philip married in 1947, they didn't move into a new family home. In fact, they've never had the opportunity to build and furnish their very own space; over the past almost 70 years, they've moved from one inherited home - <i>er</i>, castle - to another. Yes, it's nearly impossible to feel sympathy for two royals with multiple estates. But the background of their housing situation proves why it was so meaningful when Elizabeth and Philip had the opportunity to create their first family home, in the form of a yacht, in the early 1950s. </p>
<p></p>
<p><small class="source">Image Source: <a href="http://www.gettyimages.com"     rel="nofollow" target="_blank">Getty / Anwar Hussein</a></small></p>
<p>Elizabeth and Philip oversaw the design and decoration of the Britannia when it was agreed that her parents' boat, the Victoria &amp; Albert, was no longer seaworthy. Philip, who has always had a keen interest in design, took over what ended up being a lavish boat with a relatively frugal interior design scheme. Over the years, the royal yacht became scene to family trips with their kids, Charles, Anne, Andrew, and Edward, as well as a multitude of state functions. Charles and Diana took their honeymoon aboard the yacht, and in time, the queen's many grandchildren grew to appreciate their own holidays on Britannia. Prince Philip, a former naval man himself, is said to have overseen games, hijinks, and drink parties on the boat's formidable deck. </p>
<p></p>
<p><small class="source">Image Source: <a href="http://www.gettyimages.com"     rel="nofollow" target="_blank">Getty / Anwar Hussein</a></small></p>
<p>Since the <a href="http://www.royalyachtbritannia.co.uk/"  target="_blank">Royal Yacht Britannia</a> was decommissioned, the vessel has been moored in Edinburgh, Scotland, where it still sits today as a major tourist attraction in the seaside neighbourhood of <span class="nobrand">Leith</span>. During a recent press tour of the United Kingdom with Visit Britain, POPSUGAR was able to visit the yacht and see the remarkably well-preserved boat. It provided a fascinating look into what life was really like for the queen and her family as they travelled the world in style, racking up a reported one million miles at sea.</p>
<p></p>
<p><small class="source">Image Source: <a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/images/Allie-Merriam" rel="nofollow" target="_blank">POPSUGAR Photography / Allie Merriam</a></small></p>
<p>There were Philip and Elizabeth's sparse bedrooms, with the single beds they once occupied. (Apparently, it has been the custom for couples of their status and age to always have separate rooms.) Displaying the royals' very relatable frugality, Elizabeth's bed linens were hand-me-downs. Practically every room has a small bar, where the royals either served themselves or had help to make their favourite drinks, like a gin and Dubonnet for her majesty. There's also the queen's office, or sitting room, where she tended to her work and made her way through her "red boxes," sent by the government and full of official correspondence and updates, daily. All the art is bolted onto the walls, for safety. </p>
<p></p>
<p><small class="source">Image Source: <a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/images/Allie-Merriam" rel="nofollow" target="_blank">POPSUGAR Photography / Allie Merriam</a></small></p>
<p>The largest and grandest room on the ship is the living room, which has an electronic fireplace - naval rules prohibited a real fire - and floral furniture that could be found in any grandparents' sitting room. Remarkably, nothing about Britannia's interiors seemed overly stuffy or grand.</p>
<p>It's easy - and great fun - to imagine how the royal family spent their time on Britannia. The queen and her family are known for loving to keep the press at an arm's length and to retreat as often as possible from the public eye. The royal yacht offered the queen, her husband, and their extended family a chance to literally get away from it all. </p>
<p>Sadly, the good times came to an end when funding for the yacht was cut by the 1990s Labour government, who were under financial pressure.</p>
<p></p>
<p><small class="source">Image Source: <a href="http://www.gettyimages.com"     rel="nofollow" target="_blank">Getty / Max Mumby / Indigo</a></small></p>
<p>In 2011, a number of royals did, however, return to the boat. It was the venue for a prewedding party held the night before the queen's granddaughter <a href="http://www.popsugar.com/celebrity/Zara-Phillips-Wedding-Dress-Pictures-2011-07-30-073142-18511387" >Zara Phillips married rugby player Mike Tindall</a>. Prince William and his wife of three months at the time, the Duchess of Cambridge, were photographed leaving the event, along with Prices Harry and Edward. One person who did not attend? That would be the queen. Neither she nor Prince Philip has ever been back to Britannia. And given all the good times they'd had on their ship, it's understandable why the queen had to wipe away that mythical tear.</p>
</description>

<item>
 <title>Rachel Roy Makes One of Her First Official Appearances Since Beyoncé Dropped Lemonade</title>
 <link>http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/Rachel-Roy-Charity-Event-LA-May-2016-41290206</link>
 <description><a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/Rachel-Roy-Charity-Event-LA-May-2016-41290206"><img width="117" height="160" src="http://media3.popsugar-assets.com/files/2016/05/12/647/n/1922398/59becbb1_edit_img_cover_file_41288736_1463061992_GettyImages-53o8w7kj.large.jpg" /></a><p>It looks like <a href="http://www.shopstyle.co.uk/browse/rachel-roy?pid=uid921-3589-70" class="ss_inline_link auto_link_filter no_shopsense_url_rewrite" title="Shop for Rachel Roy" target="_blank">Rachel Roy</a> is taking a page out of <a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/Beyonce-Knowles" target="_blank">Beyoncé</a>'s book by making lemonade out of lemons. After receiving a ton of slack for <a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/beauty/What-Does-Becky-Good-Hair-Mean-41073416" target="_blank">reportedly being "Becky with the good hair"</a> from Beyoncé's song "Sorry," the fashion designer made one of her first official appearances since <strong>Lemonade</strong> dropped at a charity event in LA on Thursday. While she appeared cool and collected as she chatted on her cell phone, she did, in fact, opt to conceal her hair by putting it up in a bun. </p>
<p>The drama first started when she alluded to being <a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/Jay-Z" target="_blank">Jay Z</a>'s other woman in a controversial snap on Instagram. Even though she has since made a public statement deflating those rumours, that hasn't stopped the BeyHive from attacking her on social media with numerous lemon and bee emoji. See more pictures from her latest appearance ahead, and then check out <a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/Did-Jay-Z-Cheat-Beyonce-Rachel-Roy-41074618" target="_blank">the full rundown on that infamous lyric</a>.</p>
</description>

<item>
 <title>Go Inside the Glamorous Cannes Film Festival With These Celebrity Instagrams</title>
 <link>http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/Cannes-Film-Festival-Celebrity-Instagrams-2016-41289603</link>
 <description><a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/Cannes-Film-Festival-Celebrity-Instagrams-2016-41289603"></a><p>The 69th Cannes Film Festival kicked off earlier this week, and some of Hollywood's biggest stars have flocked to the South of France to get in on the glamorous action. In addition to <a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/Blake-Lively-Kristen-Stewart-Cannes-Film-Festival-2016-41269985" target="_blank">Blake Lively and Kristen Stewart's adorable friendship</a>, we've also been treated to glimpses of <a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/Blake-Lively-Cannes-Film-Festival-2016-Pictures-41286138" target="_blank">Blake's flawless style</a>, <a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/Justin-Timberlake-Cannes-Film-Festival-2016-Pictures-41286312" target="_blank">Justin Timberlake's handsome face</a>, his <a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/Anna-Kendrick-Justin-Timberlake-Sing-True-Colors-Cannes-41271043" target="_blank">duet with Anna Kendrick</a>, and a hilarious <a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/Justin-Timberlake-Trolls-Photocall-Cannes-2016-41274324" target="_blank">red carpet appearance involving trolls</a>. But the best snaps of all have come from the stars themselves! Keep reading to get an inside look at the Cannes Film Festival, and then check out <a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/fashion/Cannes-Film-Festival-Style-2016-41278151" target="_blank">all the gorgeous arrivals</a>.</p>

 <title>13 Characters Who Are Nearly Identical in DC and the Marvel Cinematic Universes</title>
 <link>http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/Marvel-DC-Characters-Similar-41287577</link>
 <description><a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/Marvel-DC-Characters-Similar-41287577"><img width="160" height="112" src="http://media1.popsugar-assets.com/files/2015/11/22/841/n/1922398/22c9dd2f_edit_img_cover_file_39074353_1447383102_bbb99RUa1.large.jpg" /></a><p>There are only so many ideas in the word - just ask the creators behind these <a href="http://www.popsugar.com/entertainment/Similar-Movies-Came-Out-Same-Time-30573184" >eerily similar movies</a>. While there are hundreds of bona fide superheroes gracing the pages of comics as well as big and small screens, some of them may strike you as familiar. Why? Well, there are two major comic book companies: Marvel and DC. Each have their own stable of unique heroes and villains, but every so often, they create characters that are shockingly similar. Sure, it might be by accident, but it could also be because the companies have been in constant competition with each other for decades. Now that there are a handful of DC shows on The CW and a bushel of Marvel movies on the big screen (including the newly released <a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/tag/Captain-America-Civil-War" target="_blank">Captain America: Civil War</a>), it's a good time to take a look at a few characters who are undeniably identical.</p>

<item>
 <title>Exploring the Theory That the Game of Thrones Book Series Title Gives It All Away</title>
 <link>http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/What-Does-Song-Ice-Fire-Mean-GoT-41287255</link>
 <description><a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/What-Does-Song-Ice-Fire-Mean-GoT-41287255"><img width="160" height="160" src="http://media3.popsugar-assets.com/files/2016/05/11/843/n/1922283/e5d594b0_edit_img_image_41250638_1462834967.large.jpg" /></a><p>Any devoted <a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/16-Types-Game-Thrones-Fans-37704205" target="_blank">Game of Thrones fan</a>, whether they also read the books or are show-only fans, is also up on <a href="http://www.popsugar.com/entertainment/Game-Thrones-Season-6-Theories-41006260" >the most relevant theories</a> about the characters. While you might not subscribe to each and every crazy theory out there, it's got to the point that if you don't know the most basic theories, you're way out of the loop. One of these theories is the <a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/How-Game-Thrones-Season-5-Has-Confirmed-Who-Jon-Snow-Real-Parents-37712897" target="_blank">R + L = J theory</a>, which we have explored here before, especially since it looks like this season is setting up the <a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/Jon-Snow-Parents-Game-Thrones-Season-6-41187970" target="_blank">reveal of Jon Snow's parents</a>. That parentage thread, along with the fact that we don't have all <a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/When-Game-Thrones-End-40976624" target="_blank">that many Game of Thrones episodes</a> left after this season, has made us explore one of these big theories. It's about the end of the series and, essentially, who ultimately wins in the titular game of thrones - so if you don't want to know, turn back now.</p>
<p></p>
<h2>The Theory: A Song of Ice and Fire Gives the Ending Away</h2>
<p>The title <strong>Game of Thrones</strong> is the name of the TV series but not George R. R. Martin's book series. The <i>first book</i> is called <strong>A Game of Thrones</strong>, but the whole book <i>series</i>, comprising the already-published five books (and the two still to come), is called <a href="http://www.amazon.com/George-Martin-Thrones-Leather-Boxed/dp/B01B3V502M?ie=UTF8&amp;keywords=a%20song%20of%20ice%20and%20fire%20box%20set&amp;qid=1462992343&amp;ref_=sr_1_4&amp;s=books&amp;sr=1-4"  target="_blank">A Song of Ice and Fire</a>. A lovely name, to be sure, but what if it's more than that?</p>
<h2>What If Ice and Fire Signify Certain People?</h2>
<p>What if this epic "song" is about how two characters - symbolised by ice and fire - come together in the end? The obvious characters are:</p>
<h2>Jon Snow = Ice</h2>
<p></p>
<p>Jon has pretty much been living in the icy cold of the Wall and beyond for six seasons.</p>
<h2>Daenerys Targaryen = Fire</h2>
<p></p>
<p>Not only has there been tons of fire imagery associated with Daenerys on the show, including her own "rebirth" in the first season in a funeral pyre for Khal Drogo and her dragons breathing fire, but the Targaryen words are also "Fire and Blood." </p>
<h2>Therefore, A Song of Ice and Fire = A Song of Jon Snow and Daenerys Targaryen</h2>
<p>A stretch? Could be, but consider the two characters who fans have an undying love for <i>and</i> who both seem destined for something more (Jon's resurrection being not just a major indication for this but also a distinct parallel to Daenerys's season-one storyline). Thus, we could be watching the story of how the Seven Kingdoms are destined for two rulers, not just one, and the Iron Throne will be cozily shared by Jon and Daenerys. Also, if the theory that Jon is a Targaryen comes true, you might be pointing out that that makes him and Daenerys related (technically, she'd be his aunt), but marrying within the family has always been a Targaryen custom. (It also seems relevant to point out that the R + L = J theory doesn't have to be true for this outcome to happen.)</p>
<p>And though I suppose other characters could fulfill the ice and fire symbols, it's almost too obvious. Need more? Also consider those <a href="http://www.ew.com/gallery/game-thrones-new-portraits/616352_kit-harington-and-emilia-clarke"  target="_blank">Kit Harington and Emilia Clarke poses for Entertainment Weekly</a> that preceded season three (interesting for characters who have never shared a frame on the show) and the <a href="http://www.popsugar.com/entertainment/Game-Thrones-3-Heads-Dragon-Theory-41259640" >three heads of the dragon theory</a> that is also gaining traction. </p>
<p>Honestly, this "theory" doesn't feel so much like a spoiler but the kind of ending that feels right, in a show that often disappoints you with its character deaths and tragedies.</p>
</description>

 <title>28 Pictures That Prove Zoë Kravitz Had No Choice but to Be Ridiculously Good-Looking</title>
 <link>http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/Zoe-Kravitz-Her-Parents-Pictures-41286334</link>
 <description><a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/Zoe-Kravitz-Her-Parents-Pictures-41286334"><img width="128" height="160" src="http://media4.popsugar-assets.com/files/2016/05/11/085/n/1922398/361e8b2e2af18d9b_BFA_12175_1497598d97MWC.large.jpg" /></a><p>It goes without saying that Zoë Kravitz is probably one of the most genetically blessed women in Hollywood - as the only daughter of rocker <a class="sugar-inline-link" title="Latest photos and news for Lenny Kravitz" href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/Lenny-Kravitz" target="_blank">Lenny Kravitz</a> and actress Lisa Bonet, 27-year-old Zoë not only inherited her parents' good looks, but also their talent (and while she's not <em>technically</em> related to her stepdad, Jason Momoa, Zoë still shares <a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/Jason-Momoa-Zoe-Kravitz-Matching-Tattoos-40880401" target="_blank">his edgy sense of style and taste in tattoos</a>). She's risen to fame both on screen in films like <strong>Mad Max: Fury Road</strong>, <strong>Dope</strong>, and the Divergent series and also showcases her musical prowess on stage with her band, Lolawolf. If that wasn't cool enough, Zoë also surrounds herself with ultracool, high-profile fashion designers and fellow starlets and has dated hot celebrity guys like <a class="sugar-inline-link" title="Latest photos and news for Penn Badgley" href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/Penn-Badgley" target="_blank">Penn Badgley</a>, Chris Pine, Drake, and her current beau, singer Twin Shadow.</p>
<p>Lenny and Lisa were married from 1987 to 1993, but despite splitting, they've remained some of <a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/Celebrities-Who-Prove-You-Can-Friends-Ex-36196881" target="_blank">the most amicable exes ever</a>. They are regularly spotted on outings around LA and even <a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/Former-Flames-Lisa-Bonet-Lenny-Kravitz-Arrive-Met-Gala-Together-37415433" target="_blank">attended the Met Gala together</a> in 2015 - and of course, they can also be counted on to link up to support Zoë at her concerts and movie premieres. We've rounded up the best photos of Zoë and her parents, just in case you needed further proof that her laid-back, rocker-cool attitude and stunning good looks don't fall far from the tree. Keep reading to see them all now.</p>
</description>

 <description><a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/Julia-Roberts-Talks-About-George-Clooney-Marriage-May-2016-41286282"><img width="160" height="160" src="http://media2.popsugar-assets.com/files/2016/05/11/210/n/1922398/c8003b8f_edit_img_image_14364447_1463024448_thumb.large.jpg" /></a><div class='sugar-embed-player'>    <iframe type="text/html"
            src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/H4klVaPZnkU"
            frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>
</div><p>It's safe to say that <a class="sugar-inline-link" title="Latest photos and news for Julia Roberts" href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/Julia-Roberts" target="_blank">Julia Roberts</a> totally approves of Amal Clooney. The actress - who <a href="http://www.popsugar.com/entertainment/Money-Monster-Trailer-39782684" >stars in Money Monster alongside her longtime pal</a>, <a class="sugar-inline-link" title="Latest photos and news for George Clooney" href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/George-Clooney" target="_blank">George Clooney</a> - recently <a href="http://www.etonline.com/news/188533_julia_roberts_sweetly_explains_how_amal_has_changed_george_clooney/"  target="_blank">opened up to Entertainment Tonight</a> about <a href="http://www.popsugar.com/celebrity/George-Clooney-Amal-Alamuddin-Wedding-35813845" >George's marriage to the human rights lawyer</a> while at <a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/fashion/Cannes-Film-Festival-Style-2016-41278151" target="_blank">the Cannes Film Festival</a>. The duo then went on to discuss their double date plans and their reputations for pulling pranks on movie sets. <item>
 <title>If You're Going to Shame Chrissy Teigen For Her Parenting Choices, Make Sure You Shame John Legend, Too</title>
 <link>http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/John-Legend-Defends-Chrissy-Teigen-After-Having-Baby-41286168</link>
 <description><a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/John-Legend-Defends-Chrissy-Teigen-After-Having-Baby-41286168"><img width="160" height="160" src="http://media4.popsugar-assets.com/files/2016/05/11/007/n/1922398/814b12ea_edit_img_image_845315_1463006795.large.jpg" /></a><p></p>
<p><br>
<p>John Legend and Chrissy Teigen <a href="http://www.popsugar.com/celebrity/Pictures-John-Legend-Chrissy-Teigen-Daughter-Luna-41015341" >welcomed their daughter, Luna</a>, less than a month ago, but the couple - Chrissy, specifically - has already been criticised for her parenting. No, not for her choice to breastfeed or use the bottle or whether or not Luna has adequate "tummy time," but for her doing <em>crazy</em> things like, you know, <a href="http://www.popsugar.com/celebrity/Chrissy-Teigen-Out-John-Legend-April-2016-41053613" >going out to dinner with her husband</a>. After commenters began <a href="http://www.popsugar.com/moms/Chrissy-Teigen-Dinner-Comments-41065370" >dragging the model and cookbook author</a> for daring to be hungry enough to leave the house, <a href="http://www.popsugar.com/celebrity/Chrissy-Teigen-Funny-Tweets-About-Being-Mom-41028039" >Chrissy spoke out on Twitter</a>, sharing a screenshot of her mentions and saying, "I went to dinner. People are pissed. Good morning!" </p>
<p>Despite the fact that Chrissy was <a href="http://www.popsugar.com/moms/Why-OK-Chrissy-Teigen-Had-Postbaby-Date-Night-41078754" >well within her right to enjoy a meal with her other half</a> at a restaurant, John took to social media on Tuesday to shut down lingering critics with the below tweet.</p>
<center>
<blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-lang="en">
<p lang="en" dir="ltr" style="text-align: center;">Funny there's no dad-shaming. When both of us go out to dinner, shame both of us so Chrissy doesn't have to take it all. We'll split it.</p>
<p>- John Legend (@johnlegend) <a href="https://twitter.com/johnlegend/status/730237684229136385"  target="_blank">May 11, 2016</a></p></blockquote>
<script async="" src="//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script></center>
<p>The Oscar winner's comments come after his family of three was <a href="https://twitter.com/johnlegend/status/730233223393894401"  target="_blank">discussed in a hilarious and spot-on Daily Show segment</a> about "mum shaming." Just another reason to love John Legend, right?</p>
</description>

<item>
 <title>Justin Timberlake Gets Down With Lady Trolls on the Red Carpet in Cannes</title>
 <link>http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/Justin-Timberlake-Trolls-Photocall-Cannes-2016-41274324</link>
 <description><a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/Justin-Timberlake-Trolls-Photocall-Cannes-2016-41274324"><img width="119" height="160" src="http://media2.popsugar-assets.com/files/2016/05/11/772/n/1922398/b2276a4dbf57c677_GettyImages-530542410_masterb9wYf7.large.jpg" /></a><p><a class="sugar-inline-link" title="Latest photos and news for Justin Timberlake" href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/Justin-Timberlake" target="_blank">Justin Timberlake</a> is really on a roll! The singer and actor hit the red carpet in style with <a class="sugar-inline-link" title="Latest photos and news for Anna Kendrick" href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/Anna-Kendrick" target="_blank">Anna Kendrick</a> at the photocall for their new animated film, <strong>Trolls</strong>, at the Cannes Film Festival on Wednesday. Justin was his usual, well, <em>animated<strong></strong></em> self as he posed for photos solo and with Anna and even stopped to bust a move with the group of women dressed as real-life Troll dolls. That day, the duo also <a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/Anna-Kendrick-Justin-Timberlake-Sing-True-Colors-Cannes-41271043" target="_blank">performed a stunning cover</a> of Cyndi Lauper's "True Colours" during a promotional event.</p>
<p>It's already been a busy week for Justin, who recently <a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/Justin-Timberlake-Cant-Stop-Feeling-41212974" target="_blank">released the Summer jam</a> "Can't Stop the Feeling" from the <strong>Trolls</strong><span class="redactor-invisible-space"> soundtrack and zipped overseas to help promote the flick. He popped up in London with Anna to <a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/Justin-Timberlake-BAFTA-Television-Awards-2016-41240224" target="_blank">attend the BAFTA Television Awards</a> on Sunday, but still made time to wish his wife, <a class="sugar-inline-link" title="Latest photos and news for Jessica Biel" href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/Jessica-Biel" target="_blank">Jessica Biel</a>, <a href="http://www.popsugar.com/celebrity/Silas-Timberlake-Matching-Onesies-Photos-41242850" >a happy Mother's Day via social media</a>. The next day, <a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/Justin-Timberlake-London-May-2016-41244877" target="_blank">Justin visited the BBC Radio studios</a> and played a hilarious game with Capital FM hosts, <a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/Justin-Timberlake-Plays-Gonna-Me-Game-Video-41273776" target="_blank">poking fun at his infamous "It's Gonna Be May" meme</a>. Keep reading to see Justin's latest photos from Cannes!</span></p>
</description>

 <title>Here's Your First Look at Emma Roberts and Dave Franco in the Adaption of Nerve</title>
 <link>http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/Nerve-Movie-Trailer-41273774</link>
 <description><a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/Nerve-Movie-Trailer-41273774"><img width="160" height="160" src="http://media4.popsugar-assets.com/files/2016/05/11/740/n/1922283/a1e7f327_edit_img_image_2387502_1462984724.large.jpg" /></a><iframe width="728" height="410" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/2PR9MOPTI7g" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen=""></iframe><p>
"Are you a watcher or a player?" You might be familiar with those words if you've read Jeanne Ryan's 2012 YA novel, <strong>Nerve</strong>, which has now been adapted into a movie starring Emma Roberts and Dave Franco. Think of it like <strong>Nick &amp; Norah's Infinite Playlist</strong> meets <strong>The Game</strong>: Vee (Roberts) and Ian (Franco) meet during a whirlwind night in New York when Vee is participating in an online game of high-stakes dares. Things start off innocently enough, but soon they get out of hand when the players realise just how manipulative their audience is. The movie is out July 27; check out the trailer and see <a href="http://www.popsugar.com/entertainment/Summer-Movies-2016-40837079" >what else is coming out this Summer</a>!</p>
</description>

<item>
 <title>The Old Gods and the New: Your Guide to Religion on Game of Thrones</title>
 <link>http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/Religions-From-Game-Thrones-41270945</link>
 <description><a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/Religions-From-Game-Thrones-41270945"><img width="160" height="106" src="http://media3.popsugar-assets.com/files/2016/04/27/858/n/1922398/ee017b42_edit_img_cover_file_15775818_1461782937_a0dbead106c7e0boLWZZ.large.jpg" /></a><p>If you've found yourself tuning out during the plentiful religious speeches in <a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/Game-of-Thrones" target="_blank">Game of Thrones</a>, you're probably kicking yourself for it now - after all, there's talk of <a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/3-Theories-About-How-Jon-Snow-Return-Game-Thrones-37738646" target="_blank">Jon Snow being brought back to life</a>, <a href="http://www.popsugar.com/entertainment/Game-Thrones-Season-6-Pictures-40153519" >Arya has gone blind</a> as punishment from some god, and now <a href="http://www.popsugar.co.uk/celebrity/What-Vaes-Dothrak-Game-Thrones-41073769" target="_blank">Daenerys might be forced to become the Dothraki version of a nun</a>. Religion plays a huge role in every single storyline on the show, so in order to fully grasp what's happening in season six, you'll probably need a refresher. Here's what you need to know about the major religions in <strong>Game of Thrones</strong> . . . including the old gods <i>and</i> the new.</p>
</description>
